div.p: This translates on the fly the text that you type. Keystrokes are intercepted on the browser with JavaScript code, which builds an XML document with the text typed so far and sends it to PresentationServer, which run a pipeline. The pipeline makes standard HTTP request to the Google Language Tool page, essentially simulating a user filling submitting a form on their site. Then the pipeline extracts the outcome of the translation and sends it back to the browser in an XML document. When the browser receives this information, it displays it in the read-only text field.
